label: Build an analysis services multidimensional database (35-40%)

skills.label: Design dimensions and measures
items: Given a requirement, identify the dimension/measure group relationship that should be selected
Design patterns for representing business facts and dimensions (many-to-many relationships)
Design dimensions to support multiple related measure groups (many related fact tables)
Handle degenerate dimensions in a cube

skills.label: Implement and configure dimensions in a cube
items: Translations, define attribute relationships, implement hierarchies, implement sql server analysis services (ssas) dimensions and cubes, create the attribute relationships that should be made for a given set of attributes in a dimension, develop new custom attributes on dimensions, detect possible design flaws in attribute relationships, implement time dimensions in cubes, manage ssas parent-child dimensions, dimension type

skills.label: Design a schema to support cube architecture
items: Multidimensional modeling starting from a star schema, relational modeling for a data source view, choose or create a topology, identify the appropriate data types with correct precision and size

skills.label: Create and configure measures
items: Logically group measures and configure measure group properties, select appropriate aggregation functions, format measures, design the measure group for the correct granularity

skills.label: Implement a cube
items: Use sql server data tools - business intelligence (ssdt-bi) to build the cube

Use ssdt-bi to do non-additive or semi-additive measures in a cube, define measures, specify perspectives, define translations, define dimension usage, define cube-specific dimension properties, define measure groups, implement reference dimensions, implement many-to-many relationships, implement fact relationships, implement role-playing relationships, create and manage linked measure groups and linked dimensions, create actions

skills.label: Create Multidimensional Expressions (MDX) and Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) queries
items: Identify the structures of mdx and the common functions (tuples, sets, topcount, scope, and more)
Identify which mdx statement would return the required result
Implement a custom mdx or logical solution for a pre-prepared case task
Identify the structure of dax and common functions, including calculate, evaluate, and filter
Identify which dax query would return the required result

skills.label: Implement custom logic in a data model
items: Create relative measures (growth, yoy, same period last year), percentage of total using mdx
Define mdx script to import partial powerpivot model

skills.label: Implement storage design in a multidimensional model
items: Create aggregations, create partitions, storage modes, define proactive caching, manage write-back partitions, implement linked cubes, implement distributed cubes

skills.label: Select an appropriate model for data analysis
items: Select tabular versus multidimensional based on scalability needs, traditional hierarchical, data volume
Select appropriate organizational bi, such as corporate bi, and team and personal bi needs and data status

label: Manage, maintain, and troubleshoot a SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) database (15-20%)

skills.label: Analyze data model performance
items: Identify performance consequences of data source view design, optimize performance by changing the design of the cube or dimension, analyze and optimize performances of an mdx/dax query, optimize queries for huge data sets, optimize mdx in the calculations, performance monitor counters, select appropriate dynamic management views for analysis services, analyze and define performance counters, monitor growth of the cache, define and view logging options

skills.label: Process data models
items: Define processing of tables or partitions for tabular and multidimensional models
Define processing of databases, cubes, and dimensions for multidimensional models
Select full processing versus incremental processing
Automate with analysis management objects (amo) or xml for analysis (xmla)
Process and manage partitions by using powershell

skills.label: Troubleshoot data analysis issues
items: Troubleshoot duplicate key dimension processing errors
Error logs and event viewer logs of ssas, mismatch of data: incorrect relationships or aggregations

skills.label: Deploy SSAS databases
items: Deployment wizard, implement ssdt-bi, deploy ssms
Test solution post deployment, decide whether or not to process, test different roles

skills.label: Install and maintain an SSAS instance
items: Identify development and production installation considerations
Define data file and program file location
Define server and database level security
Install and maintain each instance type of analysis services, including powerpivot
Back up and restore by using powershell

skills.label: Configure permissions and roles in a tabular model
items: Configure server roles, configure ssas database roles, implement dynamic security (custom security approaches), role-based access, test security permissions, implement cell-level permissions

skills.label: Implement a tabular data model
items: Define tables, import data, define calculated columns, define relationships, define hierarchies and perspectives, manage visibility of columns and tables, embed links, optimize bism for power view, mark a date table, sort a column by another column

skills.label: Implement business logic in a tabular data model
items: Implement measures and kpis, implement data analysis expressions (dax), define relationship navigation, implement time intelligence, implement context modification

skills.label: Implement data access for a tabular data model
items: Manage partitions, processing, select xvelocity versus directquery for data access

label: Build a report with SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) (25-30%)

skills.label: Design a report
items: Select report components (crosstab report, tablix, design chart, data visualization components), design report templates (report definition language), identify the data source and parameters
Determine if any expressions are required to display data that is not coming directly from the data source

skills.label: Implement a report layout
items: Implement matrixes, table, chart, images, list, indicators, maps, and groupings in reports
Use report builder to implement a report layout
Create a range of reports using different data regions
Define custom fields (implementing different parts of the report)
Implement group variables and report variables
Design for multiple delivery extension formats

skills.label: Configure authentication and authorization for a reporting solution
items: Configure server-level and item-level role-based security, configure reporting service security (setup or addition of role), authenticate against data source, store credential information, describe report server security architecture and site level security, create system level roles, item level security, create a new role assignment, assign windows users to roles, secure reports using roles, configure sharepoint groups and permissions, define varying content for different role memberships

skills.label: Implement interactivity in a report
items: Create dynamic reports in ssrs using parameters

skills.label: Troubleshoot reporting services issues
items: Use windows reliability and performance monitor data for troubleshooting
Use the reportserver: define service and web service objects
Monitor for long-running reports, rendering, and connectivity issues
Perform data reconciliation for incorrect relationships or aggregations

skills.label: Manage a report environment
items: Manage schedules, running jobs, and report server logs
Set up the execution log reporting

skills.label: Configure report data sources and datasets
items: Select appropriate query types (stored procedure versus table versus text only)
Configure parameterized connection strings (dynamic connection strings)
Configure data source options, for example, extract and connect to multiple data sources
Shared and embedded data sources and datasets
Use custom expressions in data sources
Connect to microsoft azure sql database
Implement dax and mdx queries to retrieve appropriate data sets
Work with non-relational data sources, such as xml or sharepoint lists
